doc.name: JAIRotate
doc.description: Rotate an image around a given point. The amount of rotation is in degrees. If the output is displayed, the image will be displayed the same, regardless of the point it was rotated around. The difference shows up in operations like adding (when two images are added together, a region of intersection is found; this region is effected by rotation).
doc.author: James Yeh
doc.property: The number of degrees to rotate. The default value of this parameter is the double value 0. If the port is left unconnected, then the parameter value will be used.
The subsample precision. The default value of this parameter is the integer value 8.
The x origin of the point to rotate around. The default value is the integer value 0.
The y origin of the point to rotate around. The default value is the integer value 0.
The type of interpolation to use. This is a string valued attribute that defaults to type "bilinear"
